items.title: Colts add three offensive linemen to practice squad to reinforce unit’s depleted depth
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts signed offensive guards LaDarius Henderson and Bill Murray, as well as offensive tackle Zach Thomas to their practice squad. Regarding Henderson, the 6’4”, 309 pound offensive guard was selected by the Houston Texans in the 7th round of the 2024 NFL Draft. The former CFP National Champion and All-Big Ten offensive guard […]

items.title: Colts’ Week 15 QB Analysis: It Is What It Is
items.summary: Thanks to the nflFastR project, Pro Football Focus and NFL NextGen Stats for the timely sources of data. For those of you new to this, I will publish key QB stats each week judging how well the Colts’ QB performed. Yes, O-Line, receivers, and play-calling impact these numbers but they are primarily QB measures. I will probably modify the […]

items.title: Solak spins NFL Week 15 forward: The Broncos and Rams clinched ... now can they reach the Super Bowl?
items.summary: Ben Solak sizes up the Broncos and Rams in their respective conferences, Philip Rivers' first start back in the NFL and some wild Week 15 trends to watch.

items.summary: Snoop Dogg will headline his first NFL halftime show since being part of the Super Bowl LVI halftime show.

items.title: Where the Colts’ pass rush under GM Chris Ballard has fallen short
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — The Indianapolis Colts have been desperately trying to replicate their golden pass rush era, which was headlined by a star-studded wrecking crew off the edge of Dwight Freeney and Robert Mathis. Despite not rostering a superstar edge rusher since those two retired, the Colts have found success in the 2020s by taking […]

items.summary: The Colts released their Week 16 unofficial depth chart ahead of their game against the San Francisco 49ers Monday at Lucas Oil Stadium. Check it out below:

items.summary: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 16. We also looked at players who could get contract extensions this offseason.

items.summary: Here were some of the top plays in the NFL in Week 15, as defined by Next Gen Stats.

items.title: How Shaquille Leonard rediscovered his love for football after the NFL
items.summary: Former Colts three-time All-Pro linebacker Shaquille Leonard joined this week's episode of The Colts Show for a wide-ranging conversation about everything from high school football to the 2025 Colts.

items.title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: Which teams can secure a berth in Week 16?
items.summary: In Week 16, nine NFL teams have the chance to clinch a playoff berth. The Broncos can also lock up the AFC's No. 1 seed.

items.title: Breaking down Philip Rivers’ performance against the Seahawks
items.summary: I didn’t think I would be doing a Philip Rivers breakdown this season, but here we are! Let’s go play by play and review how he did in his return to the NFL after being retired for 5 years. Below are all his pass attempts from the game, which can be watched directly on Youtube. […]

items.title: Colts’ Stock Up/Stock Down: Week 15 @Seahawks
items.summary: Stock Up Blake Grupe 4/4 on his kicks, including 54, and 60 yard makes, the last one to put the Colts up with less than a minute remaining in the game. This was perhaps the Colts’ best kicking performance since Matt Gay in Baltimore two seasons ago, and it is even more impressive considering Grupe […]

items.title: Don’t expect Richardson to replace Rivers for the Colts this season
items.summary: Anthony Richardson has been medically cleared and the talk is how fans could see him on the field again this season for the Indianapolis Colts. That was something that was in doubt after suffering an orbital fracture, but the facts are that he could be on the sidelines very soon, emphasis on sidelines. Once again, […]

items.title: Two Colts linebackers claimed off their practice squad on Monday by playoff hopefuls
items.summary: On Monday, the Indianapolis Colts lost two linebackers off their practice, as Chad Muma and Anthony Walker Jr were claimed by the New England Patriots and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers respectively. Having been claimed from the Jacksonville Jaguars from final 53-man roster cuts, Muma appeared in 5 games for the Colts this season, recording 5 […]

items.title: Colts have already made decision on starting QB for MNF against 49ers
items.summary: According to head coach Shane Steichen, the Indianapolis Colts have already made a decision on who will start at quarterback for next Monday night’s matchup hosting the San Francisco 49ers. It will be veteran quarterback Philip Rivers again for a consecutive start (via ESPN’s Stephen Holder): Having not played pro football in nearly 5 years, […]

items.title: Bill Brooks' Breakdown: How Philip Rivers and Colts receivers can continue to build chemistry
items.summary: Colts Ring of Honor wide receiver Bill Brooks provides his insight into how Philip Rivers and the his wide receivers were able to quickly build chemistry last week, and how important their communication and mutual trust will be for the Colts going forward.

items.title: NFL Week 16 odds: Eagles can clinch NFC East with win vs. Commanders
items.summary: Week 16 features huge matchups with the NFL playoffs approaching. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every game.

items.title: Clear: Philip Rivers is Colts’ starting QB; Unclear: Anthony Richardson Sr.’s status
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Philip Rivers comeback tour never was going to be a one-event experience. In the aftermath of Rivers making his first start in nearly five years in Sunday’s 18-16 loss at Seattle, Shane Steichen made it clear the Indianapolis Colts are sticking with their 44-year-old quarterback. “Yeah, Philip will be our starting quarterback,’’ [...]

items.title: Philip Rivers will be Colts' Week 16 starter, Anthony Richardson Sr. cleared 'from an eye standpoint'
items.summary: Steichen said on Monday that Richardson has been cleared to begin physical activity, but when he will return to practice is undetermined.

items.title: The Colts got exactly what they needed in Rivers… A coach.
items.summary: It is great to have a 44 year old vocal leader on your team, but his role should not be as your starting QB. Yesterday, Rivers made the entire team feel like they had a chance to win as a 13.5 point underdog. The rest of the team maintained that feeling, even after watching dying […]

items.title: Colts name Indy's Chanel Parker 2025 'Inspire Change' Changemaker
items.summary: The award recognizes individuals who are making a difference in their communities through social justice work – primarily in education, economic advancement, police-community relations or criminal justice reform – across each of the NFL’s 32 club markets.

items.title: Colts QB Anthony Richardson reportedly could be returning to the field soon
items.summary: According to CBS Sports Matt Zenitz, Indianapolis Colts quarterback Anthony Richardson has been medically cleared to practice after recovering the past several weeks from surgery for his fractured orbital bone: Zenitz’s report was later confirmed by CBS4/FOX59’s Mike Chappell. However, Chappell indicated that, “There’s no indication he’ll return for one of the Indianapolis Colts’ final […]

items.title: Colts’ Anthony Richardson Sr. cleared for football activities, but time for return is short
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Anthony Richardson Sr. has been cleared to resume football-related activities, according to a source with knowledge of the situation, but there’s no indication he’ll return for one of the Indianapolis Colts’ final three games. Richardson remains on the injured reserve list after fracturing an orbital bone during a freak accident prior to the [...]

items.title: 5 Colts Things: Philip Rivers' late completion to Alec Pierce, how injuries impacted loss to Seahawks, context for defense not allowing a touchdowns in defeat
items.summary: The Colts lost, 18-16, to the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday at Lumen Field. It was their fourth consecutive loss, but the Colts saw some things they believe they can build upon over the final three weeks of the 2025 regular season.

items.title: Around the AFC South: Texans and Jaguars both score 40+, Titans fall to 49ers
items.summary: The Jaguars improved to 10-4 and the Texans moved to 9-5 on Sunday; the Colts moved to 8-6 with their loss to the Seahawks.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 449: Somehow, It Almost Worked
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts lost a heartbreaker to one of the league's best teams after bringing Philip Rivers out of retirement to run the offense. Matt Adams recaps the game and laments a few missed opportunities. Find the Colts Blue Zone Podcast on YouTube, Apple Podcasts or Spotify.

items.title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (21.5!), Broncos' D (58!)
items.summary: The Browns' vet edge rusher and Denver's defense are in contention to rewrite the single-season sacks record book.

items.title: Storybook ending failed to materialize as Colts, Philip Rivers came up short versus Seattle
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Sometimes, and it’s rare, you can do almost everything right and still wind up with the wrong ending to a story. Like the Grandpa Phil Comeback narrative. Like the Indianapolis Colts dropping an 18-16 decision to the Seahawks Sunday in Seattle. They followed the only real script that made much sense with the [...]

items.title: Where do Philip Rivers, Colts go for rest of 2025 season after loss to Seahawks?
items.summary: The novelty of Philip Rivers' return to the NFL wore off when the clock hit zero at Lumen Field on Sunday. Now, the question becomes: Can the Colts actually pull this off over the final three weeks of the 2025 season?

items.title: Philip Rivers grateful for chance to play again, but disappointed after Colts' loss to Seahawks: 'This isn't about me'
items.summary: Philip Rivers threw career touchdown No. 422 and took every snap behind center for the Colts on Sunday, but he came away from his first game in nearly five years mainly disappointed in the outcome for his team.

items.title: Blake Grupe sets career high and Colts franchise record with 60-yard field goal
items.summary: Grupe nailed a 60-yard field goal in the Colts' Week 15 game against the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday.

items.title: Seahawks spoil Rivers' return, pick up 18-16 win over Colts
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — In one of the more improbable chapters in Indianapolis Colts' history, quarterback Philip Rivers returned from a five-year layoff to put the team in position to win, but kicker Jason Myers made a 56-yard field goal to lift the Seahawks to an 18-16 win on Sunday in Seattle. Colts' kicker Blake Grupe made [...]

items.title: Philip Rivers' comeback effort ends with Seahawks' last-second field goal in Colts' loss
items.summary: The Colts lost their fourth consecutive game, 18-16, to the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday at Lumen Field.

items.title: Colts announce 7 inactive players for Week 15 game against Seattle Seahawks
items.summary: The Colts on Friday ruled out cornerback Sauce Gardner (calf), wide receiver Anthony Gould (foot) and tackle Braden Smith (concussion/neck) while defensive tackle DeForest Buckner (neck) remains on injured reserve.

items.title: Keys to the Game: Colts at Seahawks
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts season has been spiraling over the last month. They've lost three games in a row and starting quarterback Daniel Jones to a season-ending Achilles injury. They'll bring 44-year-old Philip Rivers out of retirement today against the Seahawks to try to stop the skid and put the team back in the AFC [...]

items.title: Sideline to Sideline: Biggest Influence
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Every week Blue Zone's Chris Widlic asks the Colts one question about their time in football. Today, Chris asks the players who their biggest influence has been in their careers.

items.title: How to watch the Indianapolis Colts at Seattle Seahawks on December 14, 2025
items.summary: TV broadcast, radio and streaming information for Indianapolis Colts at Seattle Seahawks on Sunday, December 14 at 4:25 p.m. ET (Week 15).

items.title: Colts at Seahawks: What to watch for
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Areas of interest in the Indianapolis Colts’ Sunday meeting with the Seahawks in Seattle’s Lumen Field. History lesson, Part I The Colts lead the series 7-6, and are 4-4 in Seattle. The Seahawks have won the last two, including 28-16 at Lucas Oil Stadium in the 2021 season opener and 46-18 in 2017 [...]

items.title: Colts place RT Braden Smith on IR; future uncertain
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Braden Smith’s season is over, and his future with the Indianapolis Colts is uncertain. The team placed their veteran right tackle on the injured reserve list Saturday, which means he must miss at least the final four games of the regular season. Hypothetically, he could return if the Colts earn a playoff berth. [...]

items.title: Colts sign QB Philip Rivers to 53-man roster from practice squad, place T Braden Smith on injured reserve
items.summary: Rivers will be available to play in the Colts' Week 15 game against the Seattle Seahawks at Lumen Field.

items.title: Colts sign Philip Rivers to active roster; is starting at Seattle next?
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Philip Rivers is one step closer to making his first start in nearly five years. The 44-year-old quarterback who was coaching St. Michael Catholic in the semifinals of the Alabama high school state tournament last month was signed to the Indianapolis Colts’ active roster from the practice squad Saturday. That’s the final, necessary [...]

items.title: Colts-Seahawks preview: Philip Rivers isn't here to save the season. But will he play in Week 15?
items.summary: The Colts, as of Friday afternoon, have not decided who will play quarterback on Sunday against the Seattle Seahawks. But if it's Philip Rivers, he won't be expected to be the only reason why the Colts pull out of a three-game losing streak.

items.title: Philip Rivers had good week of practice, but Colts noncommittal on starting QB at Seattle
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Philip Rivers or Riley Leonard? Stay tuned. Shane Steichen declined on Friday to announce who would be the Indianapolis Colts’ starting quarterback for Sunday’s meeting with the Seahawks in Seattle, but no one should be surprised if he turns to a 44-year-old who hasn’t played in five seasons. “We’re working through that,’’ Steichen [...]

items.title: Colts name Eli Manship 'Colts High School Man of the Year'
items.summary: Eastern Hancock High School’s Manship has been announced as the winner of the 2025 award.

items.title: Colts rule out CB Sauce Gardner, WR Anthony Gould, T Braden Smith for Week 15 game vs. Seattle Seahawks
items.summary: Gardner will miss his second consecutive game, while the Colts will be without their starting right tackle and both primary kick returners on Sunday against the Seattle Seahawks.

items.title: Daniel Jones thanks Colts organization, fans for support following season-ending Achilles injury
items.summary: Jones posted on Instagram Thursday night expressing his gratitude for the encouragement he's received over the last few days.

items.title: DeForest Buckner on mend from herniated disc in neck: ‘Right now, I’m in a great spot’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – DeForest Buckner believed everything was fine. There were the normal aches and pains – those of living and working in the NFL’s violent world – but nothing out of the ordinary in the days following the Indianapolis Colts’ Nov. 2 loss at Pittsburgh. Until, that is, the 6'7", 295-pounder couldn’t perform a basic [...]

items.title: How Colts' locker room is reacting to return of Philip Rivers
items.summary: 14 current Colts players, including Mo Alie-Cox and Jonathan Taylor, were on the team in 2020 when Rivers led the Colts to an 11-5 record and a playoff appearance.

items.title: Practice Notebook: DeForest Buckner explains neck injury, recovery process and potential return to Colts
items.summary: Colts defensive tackle DeForest Buckner returned to practice this week, but has been on injured reserve since early November with a neck injury he sustained in Week 9 against the Pittsburgh Steelers.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 448: A New Dadgum Quarterback
items.summary: Desperation has set in for the Indianapolis Colts, who will turn to Philip Rivers--a Hall-of-Fame-caliber player five years removed from the NFL--to run the offense. Rivers last played pro football in January 2021, when he guided the Colts to the playoffs after a decade-plus with the Chargers. Dave Griffiths, Mike Chappell and Matt Adams try [...]

items.title: Colts select T Braden Smith as 2025 Ed Block Courage Award recipient
items.summary: The Ed Block Courage Award is given annually to a player to recognize them for courageous play.

items.title: Colts’ Riley Leonard full participant despite sprained knee; Philip Rivers’ Hall of Fame clock will reset
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Philip Rivers’ return was the overarching topic Wednesday at the Indiana Farm Bureau Football Center, as was the possibility that the 44-year-old quarterback starting his first game in 1,800 days. But there’s another possibility: Rookie Riley Leonard making his first start Sunday when the Indianapolis Colts visit the 10-3 Seahawks in Seattle. “We’ll [...]

items.title: Colts' Philip Rivers: 'There’s something about being back in this building that feels right'
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It was a typical Sunday in the Rivers’ household until it wasn’t. Philip Rivers – former long-time, prolific NFL quarterback, current head coach at St. Michael Catholic in Fairhope, Ala., admitted full-time football junkie – was watching his former team, the Indianapolis Colts, because his other former team, the Los Angeles Chargers, were [...]

items.title: Riley Leonard a full participant in Wednesday's practice as he continues preparing to play on Sunday
items.summary: Leonard sustained a knee injury during the Colts’ game against the Jacksonville Jaguars on Sunday but said he feels “really good” on Wednesday.

items.title: Practice Notebook: DeForest Buckner returns, Sauce Gardner DNP for fourth straight practice
items.summary: The Colts opened Buckner's 21-day window to be activated from injured reserve on Wednesday.

items.title: 'Dadgummit, let's freaking go:' How Colts, Philip Rivers came to their improbable reunion
items.summary: Philip Rivers on Wednesday was on the field at the Indiana Farm Bureau Football Center in a red No. 17 practice jersey, slinging the ball around and going through a Week 15 practice for the Colts. So how, exactly, did we get to this point?

items.title: Will Philip Rivers or Riley Leonard start for Colts at QB vs. Seahawks? 'We'll see how the week goes'
items.summary: The Colts are in wait-and-see mode as Philip Rivers and Riley Leonard begin practice on Wednesday ahead of Sunday's game against the Seattle Seahawks at Lumen Field.

items.title: 'Dadgummit, let's freakin' go': How Philip Rivers became the new Colts quarterback
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – When Daniel Jones went down with a season-ending Achilles injury, the Colts knew they needed to get creative. His backup, Riley Leonard, was a rookie sixth-round pick. Last year’s starter, Anthony Richardson Sr., was on injured reserve. So head coach Shane Steichen and general manager Chris Ballard hatched an unconventional plan: asking Philip [...]

items.title: Impact on Hall of Fame eligibility 'not a factor' for Philip Rivers in decision to re-join Colts
items.summary: Rivers is currently one of 26 semifinalists for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
